@BBCRadioStoke One does wonder just how many permit breaches @EnvAgency are going to erm.. permit! This is getting ridiculous now, @RedIndustries2 breach the permit, the EA gives them 6 weeks to fix it, then another breach. We are going round in circles here!

Why won‚Äôt @EnvAgencyMids act upon our complaints & have turned a blind eye to this disaster. Who tapped phones & was charged for doing so @RedIndustries2 Director. Env health are clearly compromised in some way? #likely @NewsNBC @AaronBell4NUL @StinkStopthe https://t.co/DZjDo6JQld
This is the CSO running into our Bathing Status designated site today yuk @YorkshireWater @EnvAgency https://t.co/iCMkycnKiy

@TeamBen_13 @ClareDinnisEA @EnvAgency The EA have been proven out of date, they need to come out and say their methods of investigation are not in line with the problem we have of intense concentrations of hydrogen sulphide from LFG, also properties being polluted by walls of gas where outside looks clear in the day!
@StinkStopthe @ClareDinnisEA @EnvAgencyMids Well obviously @EnvAgencyMids the pathetic approach you‚Äôve taken hasn‚Äôt worked has it . Close it , cap it , jail red !!!

urls.title: ‚ÄòIt‚Äôs terrifying‚Äô: the English village overwhelmed by landfill stink | Landfill | The Guardian
urls.description: For miles around Walleys Quarry near Newcastle-under-Lyme, people have reported waking up in the night struggling to breathe

tweets.text: A community in Staffordshire are living with doors & windows taped up.Nose bleeds, breathing issues, toxic fumes from the landfill site @WalleysL run by @RedIndustries2  The @EnvAgency have found the company  'in breach' but v little action #socialjustice  https://t.co/DehURqq0oi

Our everyday normality: Had to stop work early this afternoon as it was either unbearably hot or unbearably smelly in my small west facing home office today. We were then treated to more as we ventured out for some ‚Äòfresh‚Äô air & walk & feeling ü§¢ @StinkStopthe @EnvAgencyMids https://t.co/JVvRZcBZHd

This morning NUL was rank. Now my garden is rank. My head thumps. My air is rancid, thick, dense, toxic, filthy and poisonous. @ClareDinnisEA @pow_rebecca @MrNickKnowles @JuliaBradbury @AaronBell4NUL @DefraGovUK @MattHancock But apparently the @EnvAgency has no legal authority.

tweets.text:
@ClareDinnisEA @EnvAgencyMids It stunk over 3.5 miles away in Hanford last night, seems to be  just as bad as before the "capping" .
Isn't it odd how in the last 2 weeks 6 trucks have been turned away, may I ask how many were turned away in the previous 52 weeks? and does that figure seem right as an average?
Wtf! @EnvAgency @EnvAgencyMids why do you keep on widening the goalposts?? Next stop...... PENALTY! @StinkStopthe #StopTheStink https://t.co/D9XUYSdshy https://t.co/XXPWGYLPgd

Five more breaches makes it 10 this year at Walleys Quarry in Newcastle. 

Here‚Äôs the list of works the operators will legally have to complete. https://t.co/30V85ScswN https://t.co/VbHsqV6CWs

Thank you @SarahInNUL for compiling this. @EnvAgencyMids, please can you explain what technical, legal or financial challenges are unique to Walleys Quarry Landfill that prevent you from taking the same enforcement action? We're an understanding bunch, we just want to know why. https://t.co/yBdiMmY6Ag

@SOPH_C_ Delaying tactics, yet again. You have no clue do you? You have no authority to enforce do you? You are doing absolutely nothing to help our Borough @EnvAgencyMids @ClareDinnisEA  shame on you.  Shocking behaviour and totally unprofessional.
5 more breaches!!! @ClareDinnisEA @EnvAgencyMids When are you going to act!!!! #stopthestink #capitoff https://t.co/RpAlwO3lYB

@ClareDinnisEA @EnvAgencyMids Community engagement lol, if you're stopping the stink announce it now, if you're closing site & going into recovery mode, same, anything else, don't waste my time, fresh air Friday a joke, currently cooking tea in toxic kitchen full of hydrogen sulphide, stop stalling til2026

tweets.text: @ClareDinnisEA @EnvAgencyMids So how will this work @ClareDinnisEA? You talk down the phone at us for 20 minutes then a select few get to ask a question? Why not zoom? Better still we are organising our own community meeting, why not just come and speak to the people in person?

If we were in the USA, their EPA would have advised staying indoors and protecting the elderly and children when the H2S from #WalleysQuarry hit its peak over just ten minutes. I wonder how they'd respond to repeated exposure over months @EnvAgency 

#StopTheStink https://t.co/NDvQCA2BSO
